question: Which countries fought the "War of Attrition" from 1967 to 1970?
option1: Israel Vs. Egypt, Jordan, Palestine Liberation Organisation
option2: Iraq Vs. Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Bahrain
option3: Iran Vs. United States of America, Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates
option4: Yemen Vs. Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates, Oman
answer: Israel Vs. Egypt, Jordan, Palestine Liberation Organisation
explanation: The War of Attrition was fought over three years from 1967 to 1970 between a group of countries comprising Egypt. Jordan, Palestine Liberation Organisation and their allies on one side and Israel on the other side. The location of the war was in the Sinai Peninsula. This war mainly revolved around Egypt's attempt to overthrow Israel from the control of the Sinai Peninsula. The result of this war was mixed in which both sides claimed victory.
